p: Boswellia papyrifera (Del) Hochst olibanum , Chelidonium majus L, Cymbopogen citratus, Cymbopogen nervatus inflorescences, Cymbopogen proximus, Eucalyptus camaldulensis, Inula helenium L. subsp. turcoracemosa, Khaya senegalensis, Micromeria juliana, Nigella sativa, Pinus brutia Ten, Premna odorata, Rosmarinus officinalis, Salvia aethiopis L, Satureja aintabensis, Stachys sylvatica L, Thymus sipthorpii, Thymus vulgaris, Ulmus glabra Hudson, Urtica dioica L, Usnea barbata (L.) Mott and Veratrum album L. are widely distributed in the MENA region and have been proven to contain potential agents against MTB. The bioactive compounds extracted from these plant materials have significant in vitro activity. Specifically, their extracts have MICs of 1–50 µg/ml.
